definition: to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy
to chant/to recite/to moan/to groan/cry (of certain animals and insects)/song (ancient poem)

sentences.english: Lester ruminated for a while, toying with his fork.
sentences.chinese: 雷斯脱手里拿一把叉玩弄着沉吟了半晌。

sentences.english: Danielle thought a moment. "I've never heard of him."
sentences.chinese: 丹尼尔沉吟片刻，“我从来没听说过他。”

sentences.english: The mother ponders over this for a while, then goes home.
sentences.chinese: 婆婆沉吟了一会儿就回家了。

sentences.english: The world is tired of the death blurting out or muttering again and again.
sentences.chinese: 世界厌倦透了脱口而出或再三沉吟的死亡。

sentences.english: After some reflection, the minister granted the request.
sentences.chinese: 部长稍一沉吟之后，便批准了请求。

sentences.english: Nu Xiao pearl gold trade, the pondering Huangpu Bund waterfront.
sentences.chinese: 怒啸明珠金贸下，沉吟黄浦外滩滨。

definition: to ponder/to reckon/to turn sth over in one's mind
to force a smile/a bitter laugh
half of the day/a long time/quite a while
to reckon/to consider/to turn over in one's mind
half the day/a long time/quite a while
